author: Gerald Young
text:
Is response time the only key measure, or is it prevention?
How does your overtime usage compare to other jurisdictions?
Over the last 12 months, ICMA has been conducting significant evaluation, research, and design efforts to restructure its performance management activities and facilitate the analysis of just such issues.  High level changes include: 

Streamlined service areas and a focus on core and outcome measures, shifting the data collection burden from roughly 5,000 individual measures to 500
New, state of the art software platform with improved reporting and analytic capabilities
New service levels that appropriately focus on the performance management and analytic activities undertaken by your community and provide a clear course for development

To inform our survey update efforts, ICMA is creating short-term task forces on this and other service clusters to ensure that we build our revised performance management program on the metrics most relevant and meaningful to local government decision-making.  Task force members would be chosen to ensure broad geographic representation and various local government types.  Those selected would be asked to commit to attend two web conferences.  The task force will meet on Tuesday, March 18, at 1pm EDT.
Please email Gerald Young (gyoung@icma.org) if you are interested in serving on this task force.
